summary: The "UNCTAD/WTO International Trade Centre," now redirected to the preferred term "International Trade Centre," serves as a pivotal entity within the framework of international trade regulation. Established through the collaboration of the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) and the World Trade Organization (WTO), this Centre facilitates the integration of developing countries into the global economy. It provides essential support in trade policy formulation, capacity-building, and market access strategies, aligning with EU objectives to enhance trade relations and promote sustainable development. The Centre's initiatives are crucial for ensuring compliance with international trade laws and fostering equitable trade practices within the EU regulatory landscape.
